tasks.description: Implement search functionality to query building names and return building details including latitude and longitude.
Provide map visualization that displays the campus layout and allows the user to view a building on the map.
Enable pin or marker placement on map corresponding to the searched building.
Render markers on the map at the returned coordinates and display building information
Fetch and display building information (address, coordinates, contact details) when a building is selected.
Integrate Google Maps API to render the event venue layout.
Provide real‑time navigation and location markers for exhibitors and attendees.
Render a Google Maps instance with custom markers or overlays representing each facility.
Implement a search and filtering interface that highlights selected facilities on the map.
Provide internal routing or navigation between facilities within the premises
Authenticate the user with Twitter using OAuth.
Retrieve the authenticated user's list of friends or followers.
Fetch recent tweets for each friend.
Limit the retrieved tweets to the most recent ten per friend.
Present the tweets in the mashup interface.
Retrieve tweets from TweetingEarth based on selected time zone and display them in a list or grid
Implement the 3‑D Earth rotation and interactive time zone selection using mouse events
Handle cross‑browser compatibility and graceful degradation for older browsers
Ensure the UI works across modern browsers (Safari, Firefox, Chrome, Opera, IE9, iPad).
Display a popup or panel with tweet details when the user clicks on a timezone area
Ensure compatibility with modern browsers (Safari, Firefox, Chrome, Opera, IE9, iPad).
Fetch current weather data for a specified location from an external weather API
Aggregate and normalize the fetched weather data for consistency
Render the normalized weather data in a visual UI component (e.g., charts, icons)
Implement caching and update logic to keep displayed data fresh
Notify users of significant weather events or alerts for their location.
Build a front‑end component that consumes the stored data and creates a clean visual UI.
Create and manage favorite spots with location coordinates and metadata.
Allow users to share favorite spots with friends via social features or messaging.
Retrieve and display events or gigs near the user’s location for selected artists.
Recommend relevant events based on user preferences
Filter the retrieved events to those featuring the user's favorite artists.
Search for nearby gigs of a specified artist within a given radius.
Share a marker (e.g., generate shareable link or embed data) with friends.
Collect gift selection and recipient information from the user.
Obtain or infer the recipient's address via an external address or location service.
Calculate shipping/delivery logistics for the floral gift.
Process payment securely for the floral gift.
Generate an invoice and record the transaction in the accounting system.
Track the lifecycle of the order and delivery, producing logs and status updates for analytics.
Provide order confirmation and tracking information for the delivery.
Retrieve latitude and longitude for a place selected from the right-side box
Render the retrieved coordinates as markers on a Google Map
Allow the user to draw or select four additional places on the map after clicking the 'Next' button
Enable drawing of additional places or shapes on the map after clicking the Next button.
Optionally trigger a status update or notification when a location is selected or added.
Store the selected places in a temporary or persistent data store for later use.
Maintain and query a caller blocklist to quickly identify disallowed numbers.
Determine the current time of day to apply time-based call filtering rules.
Cross-check caller number against a personal contact list and close-friend identifiers.
Handle blocking or allowing calls and generate appropriate voice or text responses.
Submit requests to external companies and political organisations for inclusion on their do‑not‑call lists.
Automatically submit do‑not‑call requests to relevant companies and political organizations on behalf of the user.
Dispatch do‑not‑call registration requests to relevant organizations.
Integrate with telephony platform as an auto‑attendant service
Log call handling decisions for auditing and analytics purposes.
Query Google Maps API with a location query to return latitude and longitude.
Using the coordinates from T1, call a weather service to fetch a five‑day forecast.
Present the forecast data (temperature, conditions, etc.) to the user in a readable format.
Subscribe to the beebotte channel to receive and display updated forecast data.
Retrieve email metadata from a user's Gmail account to analyze inbox contents
Calculate the user's inbox zero status and related metrics
Generate rewards and update the user’s progress based on inbox metrics
Persist user score history and reward data for future retrieval.
Generate mailbox statistics (e.g., number of unread messages, size, folder distribution).
Display notifications and update UI within the Gmail plugin.
Optionally recommend music tracks to play as background while working on email (music API integration)
Accept a keyword query and return a list of matching products from the Amazon catalogue with name, description, and price information.
Retrieve and provide detailed information (name, description, price) for each product returned by the search.
Support instant autocomplete suggestions as the user types keywords.
Render autocomplete dropdown with product suggestions in real time
Ensure instant response latency suitable for live search UX.
Record phone calls through a telephony gateway.
Convert recorded audio streams to MP3 format.
Track call duration and calculate charges per minute.
Apply a 2‑minute free trial and adjust billing accordingly.
Notify callers that the call is being recorded (legal compliance).
Store MP3 files and provide access links.
Enforce legal compliance regarding recording notifications.
Authenticate user with Box using OAuth or API token
List files and folders within the user's Box account
Download or stream the selected file content
Send the file to the device's printer for printing
Provide optional print settings (paper size, orientation, copies, etc.) to customize the print job.
Track print job status and provide completion notifications
Acquire and ingest hurricane track and advisory data from a reliable source such as NOAA or a public meteorological API.
Parse raw hurricane data into a structured format (e.g., GeoJSON with timestamps) suitable for visualization.
Integrate a map viewer component to plot hurricane tracks and advisories geographically.
Integrate a timeline viewer component to display hurricane events chronologically.
Implement interaction logic to keep the map and timeline synchronized (e.g., selecting a point on the map highlights the corresponding timeline entry).
Implement timeline visualization that aligns with the map view.
Synchronize map and timeline interactions so selecting an item on one updates the other.
Parse the current page to identify the Glue object (e.g., by URL or DOM markers)
Call Glue's API to fetch the list of users who have interacted with the object and their comments
Obtain or renew an OAuth token or access cookie to authenticate requests to Glue on behalf of the visitor
Construct and display a UI overlay (e.g., modal or widget) that shows the collected friend comments
Handle cross‑origin requests and potential CORS restrictions so the bookmarklet can communicate with Glue APIs
Handle errors, rate limits, and privacy considerations gracefully
Connect to the Betfair API, authenticate, and fetch historical market data needed for analysis.
Process the fetched data and feed it into the BIRT engine to create visual charts and reports.
Export or deliver the BIRT-generated reports to end users or downstream systems (e.g., PDF, HTML).
Deploy or render the generated BIRT reports within the application
Record analytics events and provide actionable insights via an analytics interface.
Schedule recurring report generation and archival
Retrieve distance between two addresses or coordinates.
Retrieve estimated travel time between two addresses or coordinates.
Calculate estimated mileage cost based on user-provided reimbursement rate.
Store mileage expense records in an accounting system for reimbursement claims.
Generate a trip summary report with distance, time, and cost details
Compute mileage reimbursement amounts based on a per‑mile rate if requested.
Retrieve the current geographic coordinates of a specified container from SeaRates
Fetch detailed shipping status, route and ETA information for the container
Render the container position on a real-time map for visual tracking
Render real‑time position and route on an interactive map with route overlays and ETA markers
Create server‑side logic to process and expose SeaRates data to the front‑end
Determine the user's geographic location (via IP address or manual input).
Query a movie/showtime API to obtain theaters and their current or upcoming showtimes for the given location.
Format and present the retrieved theater and showtime data in a user‐friendly interface.
Compile and display the results in a user‑friendly format (e.g., list or map)
Aggregate and display theater locations and their respective showtimes in a user-friendly interface.
Query Google Maps API for street art place identifiers based on user-provided area or search term.
Aggregate and format street art metadata (name, address, image, description) from community sources.
Render map with interactive markers and pop‑ups showcasing street art details.
Embed the resulting data into a Google Maps mashup, displaying markers for each street art location.
Provide API or query parameters to support advanced filtering/sorting and map marker coordinates for front‑end rendering.
Retrieve product listings from Amazon eCommerce API.
Implement keyword search functionality against Amazon's catalog.
Apply filters (price range, category, seller ratings) to search results.
Present the filtered and sorted product list to the user in a user-friendly format.
Handle checkout workflow and payment processing
Serve targeted advertising banners alongside product listings
Track order shipment status via Amazon Tracking API or similar
Generate personalized gift recommendations using item similarity and user preferences
Retrieve order status and tracking information
Retrieve and render high‑resolution map tiles or satellite imagery for the target geographic area.
Query a database or external service to obtain detailed real‑estate listings for millions of properties.
Collect neighborhood statistics including crime rates, school performance data, and other demographic indicators.
Aggregate the map, listings, and neighborhood data into a cohesive user experience.
Optionally manage user email subscriptions or notifications about properties (e.g., send alerts when new listings appear).
Implement search and filter capabilities for users to narrow down listings.
Maintain synchronization between listing data and map visualization, ensuring real‑time updates.
Handle user authentication and session tokens
Retrieve static company data from a database or external source
Create and store a new review for a given company
Accept a rating value from a user and update company’s overall rating
Allow users to assign custom tags to companies
Provide search and filter capabilities based on tags, rating, or other criteria
Aggregate and return rating statistics and review listings for a company
Allow users to share company info via social channels
Compute the geographic distance between two specified city names
Build an ordered list of landmark stops that can be visited in a single day with appropriate travel times and opening hours
Retrieve a list of notable landmarks or points of interest within a specified city.
Generate a day‑trip route that connects the retrieved landmarks in a logical order (e.g., minimizing travel time or distance).
Format and return the finalized itinerary, including timestamps, distances, and suggested transport methods.
Construct an optimal day‑tour itinerary that sequences landmarks within a user‑defined time budget.
Store and retrieve ride track data in a database
Calculate and provide optimal routes between two or more waypoints
Render stored ride tracks on a Google Maps interface
Authenticate users and manage session state for the ride portal
Allow users to share ride data with other community members
Collect and process live GPS data from rider devices for real-time tracking
Integrate real‑time GPS data ingestion from users’ devices
Update ride metadata such as title, description, or difficulty rating.
Authenticate and authorize users for protected actions (uploading, liking, commenting).
Generate usage analytics for the platform
Retrieve a list of US golf courses with geolocation and basic details from a suitable data source
Render the golf courses on a Google Maps view and provide an interactive marker system
Integrate real‑time weather information for each golf course location
Implement search and filter functionality to allow users to find courses based on attributes (e.g., state, rating, course type)
Present detailed course information (e.g., course length, rating, hazards) to the user
Provide a responsive UI that synchronizes map markers, search results, and detail panels.
Consume company‑specific APIs or data feeds to gather real‑time job postings and update the local job database
Implement a search engine that allows users to query the aggregated job database by keyword, location, industry, and job type
Deliver detailed job descriptions and application links for each listing, including metadata such as salary range, required qualifications, and application deadline
Facilitate secure user accounts for job seekers to save searches, bookmark listings, and receive personalized job alerts
Optionally incorporate advertising or monetization components (e.g., banner ads, partner links).
Manage user authentication and preferences for alerts.
Consume the Fundrace Project data source to fetch donation records containing zip code, party affiliation, and donation amount.
Aggregate donation amounts by zip code and party, producing totals and percent shares for each combination.
Translate zip codes into geographical coordinates (latitude/longitude) for mapping purposes.
Expose API endpoints or data feeds that supply the aggregated data in formats suitable for charting libraries and map visualizations.
Embed interactive map layers to display donation density and party affiliation per ZIP
Integrate all components into a cohesive web application for end‑users
Expose a public API endpoint to serve the aggregated data and visualizations
Authenticate with Flickr OAuth and fetch geotagged photos for specified users, tags, or collections
Process and store photo metadata, including latitude, longitude, and thumbnail URLs
Integrate a mapping service (e.g., Google Maps, Leaflet) to plot photo locations on an interactive map
Develop a Flash-based UI that renders the map, photos, and provides search/filter controls
Render an interactive Flash map that places markers at photo locations and displays thumbnails on interaction.
Enable marker click events to display photo details and thumbnails.
Handle user authentication with Flickr and manage API rate limits or caching.
